2017/2018球季意甲賽程：

常見問題：
AC米蘭同國際米蘭又係有"米蘭"，應該點分？
ANS：AC米蘭簡稱米蘭，國際米蘭叫國米，避免稱呼做AC，因為AC係球會咁解，而milan先係名既簡稱。
AC米蘭仲係咪「老人院」？
ANS：現時全隊平均年齡為25歲。
今個轉會窗到目前為止簽咗咁多球員，遲啲仲會唔會有錢買人？
ANS：其實買球員好少會一炮過畀，多數都係分期，所以仲會有錢簽其他球員。
簽咗咁多球員會唔會過唔到FFP？
ANS：早前米蘭管理層有同UEFA探討經營計劃。
http://sempremilan.com/ts-fassone-meets-uefa-to-discuss-ac-milan-business-plan（By 二石四鳥)[/quote]

唔係講話撐撚，但佢啲賽後訪問係唔錯

AC米蘭主場0比1不敵賓尼雲圖，聯賽六輪不勝，仍積54分暫列第6位。賽後加度素接受了Mediaset Premium的訪問：“很明顯，球隊正處於一個螺旋式下滑的過程中。當你在沒有靈魂的狀態下踢球時，只能像今天這樣感到尷尬。我是第一個應該負責任的人，但是當我們分析比賽後，就會知道找任何借口都毫無意義。當你和賓尼雲圖這樣的球隊比賽時，即使他們在積分榜上墊底，我們也不能喪失決心和球隊的靈魂。”

“無論我們使用兩個、三個或四個前鋒的陣型，這都無關緊要，因為我們在這場比賽中沒有展現出內心的力量或激情，這樣的狀態無法做到任何事情。我們的進攻對他們來說不痛不痒，沒有對賓尼雲圖造成實質性的傷害。”

“我們必須向球迷道歉，因為我們身披如此富有聲望的球衣，就不能踢出這樣尷尬的比賽。”

“你可以看到球員們在場上對跑位的理解完全是錯誤的。古圖尼跑到邊路去了，因為我們找不到對手的空當。在上周的訓練中球員們在跑位方面表現不錯，但是當我們在比賽中遇到了障礙時，卻無法對此作出反應，我們在場上找不到對策。”

“我不能到這裡來說一些假話。很明顯我們在比賽中踢得很掙扎，我們甚至不需要對手做任何特別的事情來擊敗我們。我們在進攻中的前插不夠及時，行動遲緩，然後只能回撤，周而復始，這就是我們的問題。我們不能說自己沒有動力，因為我們仍然在為歐聯杯而戰，除此之外，我們是米蘭，我們總是要為勝利而戰。”

“你可以看到這是一支不冷靜，不專注，不自信的球隊。很多球員都很年輕，當他們沒有入球的時候，就會感到緊張。”

“這個賽季我們消耗了很多精力來回到積分榜的這個位置。我們現在很想念查漢奴古，他有一些非常獨特的特點。但我希望看到一個由我訓練的團隊在比賽中展現出靈魂。我不能只談決心，因為今天的比賽中，我們給人的印象是得過且過，在球場上隻做出了最微小的努力。”

“我們看起來不是一個團隊，這是我最擔心的情況。我感到很失望。賓尼雲圖最近踢得很好，我賽前曾警告過球員我們會遇到困難，所以現在難過沒有用，他們應該早點想到這種情況。為歐霸盃而戰是我們的責任，我今天沒有從球員的表現中看到這種渴望和球隊歸屬感。”

AC米蘭主場0比1不敵賓尼雲圖，聯賽六輪不勝，仍積54分暫列第6位。賽後加度素接受了Mediaset Premium的訪問：“很明顯，球隊正處於一個螺旋式下滑的過程中。當你在沒有靈魂的狀態下踢球時，只能像今天這樣感到尷尬。我是第一個應該負責任的人，但是當我們分析比賽後，就會知道找任何借口都毫無意義。當你和賓尼雲圖這樣的球隊比賽時，即使他們在積分榜上墊底，我們也不能喪失決心和球隊的靈魂。”

“無論我們使用兩個、三個或四個前鋒的陣型，這都無關緊要，因為我們在這場比賽中沒有展現出內心的力量或激情，這樣的狀態無法做到任何事情。我們的進攻對他們來說不痛不痒，沒有對賓尼雲圖造成實質性的傷害。”

“我們必須向球迷道歉，因為我們身披如此富有聲望的球衣，就不能踢出這樣尷尬的比賽。”

“你可以看到球員們在場上對跑位的理解完全是錯誤的。古圖尼跑到邊路去了，因為我們找不到對手的空當。在上周的訓練中球員們在跑位方面表現不錯，但是當我們在比賽中遇到了障礙時，卻無法對此作出反應，我們在場上找不到對策。”

“我不能到這裡來說一些假話。很明顯我們在比賽中踢得很掙扎，我們甚至不需要對手做任何特別的事情來擊敗我們。我們在進攻中的前插不夠及時，行動遲緩，然後只能回撤，周而復始，這就是我們的問題。我們不能說自己沒有動力，因為我們仍然在為歐聯杯而戰，除此之外，我們是米蘭，我們總是要為勝利而戰。”

“你可以看到這是一支不冷靜，不專注，不自信的球隊。很多球員都很年輕，當他們沒有入球的時候，就會感到緊張。”

“這個賽季我們消耗了很多精力來回到積分榜的這個位置。我們現在很想念查漢奴古，他有一些非常獨特的特點。但我希望看到一個由我訓練的團隊在比賽中展現出靈魂。我不能只談決心，因為今天的比賽中，我們給人的印象是得過且過，在球場上隻做出了最微小的努力。”

“我們看起來不是一個團隊，這是我最擔心的情況。我感到很失望。賓尼雲圖最近踢得很好，我賽前曾警告過球員我們會遇到困難，所以現在難過沒有用，他們應該早點想到這種情況。為歐霸盃而戰是我們的責任，我今天沒有從球員的表現中看到這種渴望和球隊歸屬感。”
幾時開始要淪落到j賽後訪問
無野可以J，谷到前列腺漲大喇Ching

The top four teams in the Serie A qualify for the UEFA Champions League (from the 2017–18 season).

The top three teams qualify directly to the group phase, while the fourth-placed team enters the competition at the playoff qualifying round and must win a two-legged knockout tie in order to enter the group phase.

Teams finishing fifth and sixth qualify for the UEFA Europa League tournament. A third UEFA Europa League spot is reserved for the winner of the Coppa Italia.

If the Coppa Italia champion already qualified for European football by finishing among the top five teams in Serie A, the seventh-ranked team in Serie A is awarded the UEFA Europa League spot. The three lowest-placed teams are relegated to Serie B.

The winners of the 2016–17 UEFA Champions League and 2016–17 UEFA Europa League are each given an additional entry if they do not qualify for the 2017–18 UEFA Champions League through their domestic league. Because a maximum of five teams from one association can enter the Champions League, if both the Champions League title holders and the Europa League title holders are from the same top three ranked association and finish outside the top four of their domestic league, the fourth-placed team of their association will be moved to the Europa League.

歐聯冠軍及歐霸冠軍若未能透過其國內聯賽成績獲得參賽權，均可額外獲得一個參賽資格,但由於歐洲冠軍聯賽每國參賽席位最多只有 5 個，因此若兩項賽事之冠軍均來自相同並且屬於首 3 名成員國，而雙方皆未能於聯賽以首 4 名完成，那麼聯賽第 4 名球隊將需要讓出歐聯席位，從而參與歐洲聯賽。

AC Milan and especially the Chinese ownership are seriously considering radical changes at the club with Massimiliano Mirabelli under risk of being fired.

Massimiliano Mirabelli has lost the trust of the Chinese ownership. After nearly 250 million euros spent last summer, the Chinese and Elliot were hopping for different results instead the Rossoneri were never able to challenge for a Champions League spot and are now risking even Europa League participation for next season.

In the meanwhile the club is looking at various alternatives for the role of sports director. The main candidate is considered Walter Sabatini, former Inter and Roma director. La Gazzetta dello sports reports that representatives of AC Milan and Sabatini himself had a meeting recently in London to discuss his availability.

While the other options are Cristiano Giuntoli of Napoli and Michael Emenalo of Monaco. It can not be excluded a nostalgic push for a return of Ariedo Braida, who today is serving as Barcelona’s main market man. So many names for the post-Mirabelli, but for now the Rossoneri director continues to work with confidence.

Milan want Muriel?

Milan are reportedly interested in Sevilla forward Luis Muriel, with Nikola Kalinic to leave in the summer.

The Rossoneri’s only certainty in attack for next season is Patrick Cutrone, as neither Kalinic nor Andre Silva have impressed this term.

The former is already on the market, while Silva is young enough that he could be given another chance next season.

According to Tuttosport, the Diavolo are looking to bring in another striker in the summer and they had identified Edin Dzeko of Roma and Torino’s Andrea Belotti as targets.

However, with no Champions League football and a Financial Fair Play sanction to come, Milan cannot afford the outlay it would take to sign one of those players.

Therefore, the newspaper reports, they’ve turned their attention to Muriel who already has Serie A experience with Udinese and Sampdoria.

While the Colombian isn’t an out-and-out striker, he could link well with Cutrone and has already proven he can perform in Italy.

Roma and Milan consider Zaza

Milan and Roma are on high alert after reports Simone Zaza has been told he can leave Valencia this summer.

According to Superdeporte, Zaza, his father Antonio, Coach Marcelino and director of sport Pablo Longoria had a summit at the club headquarters this morning.

It is rumoured Zaza was told he can start looking for another team, as he will not get more playing time next season.

He is one of several players ready to leave Valencia, as they struggle with Financial Fair Play regulations.

Milan and Roma are believed to be interested in bringing Zaza back to Serie A, according to Calciomercato.com.

It hasn’t been a bad campaign by any means, as the 26-year-old scored 12 goals with two assists in 30 Liga matches.

However, nine of those were scored in the opening 10 rounds and he found the net only twice in 2018.

Valencia bought Zaza from Juventus for €18m after an initial loan period in January 2017.

Calhanoglu: ‘Couldn’t speak to Montella’

Milan midfielder Hakan Calhanoglu says his slow start was partly down to not being able to speak to Vincenzo Montella - “he didn’t speak English”.

The Turkish international joined from Bayer Leverkusen in the summer, but initially struggled to adapt to Italian football.  

“I made my first trip to Milan by plane,” Calhanoglu recalled, speaking to Forza Milan.

“I was thinking about a new style of football, my new club and my new teammates. It’s a big change coming to a club like Milan, a club with great history.

“As I went to Milanello I was thinking about the great champions who had been there, like [Paolo] Maldini or [Gennaro] Gattuso, my head was buzzing.

“It wasn’t easy to make an impact straight away because we were living in a hotel, and also because of the language. Talking and communicating with my teammates wasn’t easy.

“Now I’m happy, I understand the others and I can talk to them. I like the Italian culture, it reminds me of Turkey.

“After being banned for four months I needed to play a bit to get in to the right physical condition.

“It’s difficult if you can’t communicate though and Montella didn’t speak English, only Italian.

“Obviously I know football, I know what position I have to take up on the pitch and how to behave during the game, but I need to feel the support of a Coach who talks to me.

“Gattuso gave me a lot of confidence because he really helps me and communicates with me. He’s always told me to free my mind and focus on football.

“He believed in the qualities I had and said that by doing that the results would come.”

Calhanoglu was then asked who is helping him to learn Italian.

“At the start [Ricardo] Rodriguez helped me a lot because he knows German. The only thing is he doesn’t know Italian all that well either, so Fabio Borini helped me most with your language.”

反蒙先鋒之一?

Berlusconi: 'I'd buy Milan back'

“If it keeps going like this, I won’t deny that sooner or later I’ll buy Milan back,” confessed Silvio Berlusconi at a political rally.

The businessman, media mogul and former Prime Minister of Italy was in charge of the club for 30 years until selling up to Yonghong Li in a deal worth €740m.

Berlusconi was at a political rally for his Forza Italia party in Udine this evening and spoke to the crowd.

“The way things are going, I’ll end up buying Milan back again,” he said.

Berlusconi also suggested polls had told him selling the club was one of the reasons why his Forza Italia party “against all expectations was stuck at 14-14.5 per cent” of the vote in recent elections.

“Many stop me and ask why I sold the club to who knows who and they blame me for the conditions of the current squad.

“I will confess something. If it keeps going like this, I won’t deny that sooner or later I’ll buy Milan back.”

The Rossoneri are due to face Financial Fair Play restrictions and it remains to be seen if Li will be able to repay his loans to Elliott Management.

AC Milan: Monchi linked with rossoneri director job

AS Roma sporting director Monchi has been linked with a move to Serie A rivals AC Milan, Gazzetta dello Sport report.

Now 49, the Spaniard Monchi joined Roma in the summer of 2017 after leaving his childhood club Sevilla, where he became the sporting director in 2000 after retiring as a player months before it. He has helped discover players like Sergio Ramos, Alberto Moreno and Jesus Navas in the past.

Gazzetta dello Sport report that Milan see Monchi as one of the alternatives to have their Director of Football, with rumors surrounding the exit of Massimiliano Mirabelli very strife.

It is said that the rossoneri manager Rino Gattuso, managing director Marco Fassone and Mirabelli held a meeting in order to talk about the club's future transfer plans, with reports suggestive of Mirabelli's position being under threat already.

From France: Arsenal and AC Milan to go head to head for Lyon ace

Reports from French outlet Football365 suggest that AC Milan are set to go head to head with Arsenal for the signing of Lyon star Nabil Fekir.

The 24-year-old Fekir has become one of football's best emerging talents over the last two seasons and has impressed since having recovered from a long-term knee injury that he suffered around two years ago. This season, the Frenchman has impressed, having scored 17 times and assisting seven times in 27 Serie A appearances for Lyon.

Football 365 report that the Gunners and the rossoneri are set to provide each other stiff competition for the signing of Fekir.

The winger has drawn links with Arsenal since quite a few months and he is seen as a man who can provide the Gunners attack with much needed impetus, but the rossoneri will not let them get Fekir easily.

The Frenchman is rated at 40 million euros and has a contract that runs out in the summer of 2020.

Abate to move to MLS?

Milan full-back Ignazio Abate is reportedly wanted by Major League Soccer side Los Angeles Galaxy.

The defender is out of contract in June 2019, but it’s expected that he’ll move on this summer.

According to Tuttomercatoweb, LA Galaxy are interested in bringing him to MLS, where he’d link up with former teammate Zlatan Ibrahimovic.

Much like Ibra though he wouldn’t be a Designated Player, as all three slots are already occupied by Romain Alessandrini, Giovani dos Santos and Jonathan dos Santos.

That means he would not be exempt from the salary cap of $4.035m per team as Sebastian Giovinco is at Toronto FC.

據足球市場網報導，AC米蘭體育總監米拉比利前往班拿貝球場觀看了皇馬與拜仁的次回合比賽，而他的主要目的是為了考察皇馬前鋒賓施馬。

　　在香港時間今天淩晨的比賽中，皇馬依靠著賓施馬的梅開二度2-2戰平拜仁，以總比數4-3連續三年殺進歐冠盃決賽。足球市場網報導稱，AC米蘭體育總監米拉比利以及球隊經理艾比亞迪都來到了現場觀戰，他們的目的就是為了考察皇馬球星賓施馬。

　　足球市場網聲稱，紅黑軍團希望在這個夏天繼續補強鋒線，而賓施馬正是一個非常合適的收購目標。雖然米蘭不會在夏窗投入太多收購資金，但是他們仍然希望能夠簽下一名世界級前鋒，而皇馬主席佩雷斯又已經在開始尋找新的前鋒人選，因此賓施馬有很大可能會選擇離隊。

　　除了賓施馬之外，足球市場網還表示同樣得不到出場時間的施華路斯也成為了米蘭的收購目標，不過英超豪門利物浦也正在密切關注著施華路斯的近況。

Mirabelli plans big signing

It’s reported Milan sporting director Massimiliano Mirabelli is planning to sign a striker who will “bring the house down”.

The Rossoneri are looking for a reliable goalscorer this summer, after both André Silva and Nikola Kalinic struggled following their arrivals in 2017.

According to Premium Sport, Mirabelli has told friends that he’s planning on signing a striker who would “bring San Siro down”, though he didn’t name any names.

It’s not clear though if the director will be around for the summer transfer campaign, as there have been multiple reports that he’ll be sacked.

Mirabelli himself did little to dispel those rumours, telling Sky last month “if someone wants to come and take [my job] then I’ll give it to them”.

Niang: 'Not represented by Raiola'

Torino striker M’Baye Niang declared via Twitter that he is “not represented by Mino Raiola” after breaking with the agent.

It was Raiola who had brought the forward to Milan initially, then sold to Toro for €14m last summer.

There were reports over the last few days that Raiola was planning to move Niang on and bring in another of his clients, Mario Balotelli.

However, this evening Niang posted a message in French on his Twitter account.

“I am not accustomed to expressing myself on this subject, but just to be absolutely clear, I am not represented by Mino Raiola and well by my family.”

Gattuso: ‘Not too late for Mastour’

Milan Coach Gennaro Gattuso says Hachim Mastour “became more famous for making videos than playing” but “I’ve noticed a few improvements”.

The 19-year-old was expected to be a future star, with videos of his tricks and dribbling going viral.

However, he’s still to make a single Serie A appearance for the Rossoneri and he failed to make the breakthrough at either Malaga or PEC Zwolle.

This season he’s been involved in the Primavera team, which Gattuso was Coach of until he replaced Vincenzo Montella in the top job.

“We’ve talked a lot lately,” Gattuso said in his Press conference today.

“I even threatened him because he became more famous for making videos than playing, but he doesn’t do that anymore because I told him I’d knock his teeth out!

“In recent months he’s improved some things in training and we decided to let him play in the Primavera.

“The train has passed but he’s not 50-years-old, he’s 20-years-old [in June] and I think he has to take stock of his mistakes.

“He needs to play consistently, because we can see he’s lost some match sharpness. I’ve noticed a few improvements though.”
